heading: buffett says 'no' to tech stocks
subheading: the oracle of omaha prefers no-brainer blue chips, making no secret his lack of tech knowledge.
author: wired news report
text: the tech sector see, while the man knows how to make money, he doesn't know -- and doesn't profess to know -- much about technology, preferring instead the no-brainer blue chips that have made him america's second wealthiest billionaire behind bill gates."i've been an admirer of bill gates but i'm sorry i can't put my money behind him," buffett told berkshire hathaway shareholders at their annual meeting monday. "i don't know what that world will look like in 10 years. technology is just something we don't understand, so we don't invest in it."the oracle of omaha finds internet businesses like yahoo to be too uncertain compared with tried-and-true holdings like coca-cola and disney."if i taught a class, on my final exam i would take an internet company and ask [my students], 'how much is this company worth?'" he said.
